sections.heading: Team Composition
rules: Each team will consist of 6 players.

sections.heading: Match Format
rules: Each match will be an 6-over match.
The batting team must divide the entire team into 3 pairs.
Each batting pair can bat for a maximum of 2 overs.

sections.heading: Batting & Scoring Rules
rules: 4s and 6s are allowed.
Allowed modes of dismissal: Bowled, Caught, Run Out, Play down, Hit-wicket & Stumped out
If the bowling team takes a wicket, -4 runs will be deducted from the batting team's total.

sections.heading: Bowling Rules
rules: Only one bowler is allowed to bowl a maximum of 2 overs.
All other bowlers can bowl a maximum of 1 over each.
Overstepping will be treated as a No Ball.
Waist-height full toss will also be treated as a No Ball.
No free hit will be awarded for a No Ball.

sections.heading: Mid Pitch dead bowl rule
rules: A mid-pitch line will be marked on the ground.
Any ball whose first bounce lands before the mid-pitch line will be declared a dead ball
No run will be awarded for a dead ball.
If the batter hits a dead ball, it will not be counted as a legal delivery.

sections.heading: Batting Guard & Stance
rules: There will be no restriction on wicket coverage by the batter.
Batting guard and stance restrictions are not applicable.

sections.heading: Change of Strike Rule
rules: The striker and non-striker must exchange roles at the end of every over, irrespective of whether runs are scored or not.

sections.heading: Chasing & Overs Completion
rules: Even if the second batting team crosses the target before the 4th over, they must bat for all 6 overs.
Net Run Rate (NRR) will be calculated at the end in case of league-stage ties.

sections.heading: Tie-Breaker
rules: In case of a tie, a Super Over will be conducted to decide the winner.

sections.heading: Spirit of the Game & Authority
rules: Players are expected to maintain fair play and sportsmanship.
The umpire‚Äôs and organizing committee's decision will be final in all match-related matters.

sections.heading: Team & Match Format Cricket
rules: For Junior Category, each team will consist of 9 players.
For Men's Category, each team will consist of 6 players.
Each match will be an 8-over match.

sections.heading: Bowling Rules
rules: A maximum of two bowlers are allowed to bowl up to 2 overs each.
Bowling Restricted Area Rule
Bowlers must bowl only from the restricted bowling area.
Both legs must be grounded at the time of delivery.
Any violation will be considered a No Ball.

sections.heading: Batting Rules
rules: There will be a cap on individual maximum score: 35 runs for Junior category and 40 runs for Men's category.
After reaching the cap, the batsman must retire.
Retired batsmen may return only as the last wicket.
If two batsmen retire, they will return in the same sequence in which they retired.

sections.heading: Special Dismissal Rules
rules: A direct hit ball landing outside the boundary without bouncing inside, or touching any living or non-living object outside the field, will be considered OUT.
The last batsman is allowed to bat.

In case of the last batsman: An extra runner will be provided from the same team. A run-out will be considered on either end. If the runner leaves the non-striker‚Äôs crease before the batsman hits the ball, the delivery will be considered a dot ball.

sections.heading: Scoring Rules
rules: Runs for byes and overthrows are allowed and will be added to the total score.
Leg byes are NOT allowed.
Only 4s are allowed; 6s are NOT allowed.
If the batter hits a dead ball, it will not be counted as a legal delivery.
